titleproper.value:
Preliminary Inventory to the Karen Stamm: Women's Reproductive and Health Rights Papers
                    <num>TAM.212</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T19:02-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Karen Stamm: Women's Reproductive and Health Rights Papers

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
Karen Stamm was an activist in the women's health and reproductive righs movements of the 1970s and 1980s, notably through her role in the Committee to End Sterilization Abuse (CESA) and its successor, the Committee for Abortion Rights and Against Sterilization Abuse (CARASA). Stamm helped found and at some point chaired committees in both organizations. The Papers document those struggles for reproductive freedom and equality, particularly the activities of the Committee to End Sterilization Abuse (CESA) and its successor, the Committee for Abortion Rights and Against Sterilization Abuse (CARASA). In addition to minutes and agendas, correspondence, research and resource files, legislative and lobbying campaign materials, newsletters, pamphlets, and other educational and advocacy materials from CESA and CARASA, there is a mix of materials, mostly newsletters, publications, pamphlets and correspondence of member organizations, organizations they have worked in coalition with, and organizations that have opposed them are also part of the collection. 
                <emph render="bold">NOTE:</emph> Certain items or portions of the collection are fragile, and will require permission to access.

p.value: NOTE: Since the bulk of the collection is stored offsite, three working days advance notice must be given so that the materials may be retrieved.

Karen Stamm was an activist in the women's health and reproductive righs movements of the 1970s and 1980s, notably through her role in the Committee to End Sterilization Abuse (CESA) and its successor, the Committee for Abortion Rights and Against Sterilization Abuse (CARASA). Karen Stamm helped found and at some point chaired committees in both organizations. Both CESA and CARASA were committed to creating a more inclusive reproductive rights movement that took into account the fact that all women did not have equal control of their reproduction and that this choice was in fact limited by race and class. Both rejected the notion that overpopulation was the cause of social and economic ills, called for the end of sterilization abuse as a means of population control, and advocated for the economic conditions that were necessary to undergird economically disadvantaged women’s right to choose freely.

ACLU-American Civil Liberties Union; AVS-Association for Voluntary Sterilization; CARASA-Committee for Abortion Rights and Against Sterilization Abuse; CESA-Committee to End Sterilization Abuse; CCR-Center for Constitutional Rights; CRROW-Coalition for the Reproductive Rights of Workers; Health/PAC-Health Policy Advisory Center KS-Karen Stamm; (D)HEW-US Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare; NWHN-National Women’s Health Network; NYC HHC-New York City Health and Hospital Corporation; NYCOSH-New York Committee for Occupational Safety and Health; R2N2-Reproductive Rights National Network

subject.value: Women |x Health and hygiene |z United States.

corpname.value: Committee to End Sterilization Abuse (New York, N.Y.).

dsc.value:
Newspaper Clippings, 1977-1985 1 General note

Preservation Note: Clippings not in folders and are fragile. Please handle with care.

Contents include clippings, mostly from the New York Times, but also from the New York World, In These Times, The Progressive, Guild Notes, Penthouse and others re: a variety of topics, including women’s health, PMS, vasectomy, reproductive rights in the workplace, black and Puerto Rican discrimination suits, surge in Indian population, and AIDS.

Loose Papers: These are strewn in between news clippings: Letter from CCR to CRROW; Oct 1979; Newsletter, NWHN; Nov 12, 1979; Letter from Sen. Daniel Moynihan re: ratification of ERA w/ attached Congressional Record; Aug 1982; Pamphlet for Abortion Rights Week; Oct 1979; Letter from CRROW to KS w/ attached list of endorsers and statement of purpose; Nov 1980; Newsletter, NYCOSH; Sep 1980 Fundraising letter from Gloria Steinem re: supporting Sen. Bob Packard against “Right-to-Life” Movement; Brochure re: Cu-7 brand of intrauterine contraceptive; Aug 1977; Newsletter, Catholic Negro-American Mission Board; Mar-Apr 1979; Leaflet, “Dangerous Hidden Connections of Anti-Choice ‘Pro-Life’ Movement,” Women’s Rights Action Group; undated.

 Newspaper Clippings, 1982-1985 2 General note

Preservation Note: Clippings not in folders and are fragile. Please handle with care.

Contents include clippings, mostly from the New York Times re: a variety of topics that include young girls learning self-defense, DES cancer drug lawsuit, battered wives, gay and lesbian rights, sterilization regulations, Betty Friedan, and black women’s perception that white women are leading in job gains.

 Newspaper Clippings, 1976-1979 3 General note

News clippings mostly taken from the New York Times and cover a range of topics from a scarcity of staple black beans in Brazil, the national grain reserve, a surge in Mexican illegal immigration, and ethical questions re: the CIA’s mind control experiment.

Contains a mix of materials relating to a range of women’s health subjects, including sterilization abuse and regulations, birth control research, workplace discrimination as it relates to forced sterilization, Abortion Rights Week organizing, and intrauterine Diethylstilbestrol (DES) exposure. Materials range in date from 1976 to 1979 and include correspondence, newsletters, factsheets, brochures, press releases, drafts of position papers, and medical research papers. Organizations represented include CARASA, NY Inco for DES Action, CESA, the Consumer Commission on Accreditation of Health Services, and the Coalition for the Medical Rights of Women.

 Papers, Records and Publications I 4 General note

Publications: The Abortion Business: A Report on Free-Standing Abortion Clinics, Women’s Research Action Project; 1975. The Women’s Center Reid Lectureship: Papers by Alice Walker and June Jordan; Nov 11, 1975. Address on the Population Problem at MIT, Robert S. McNamera, World Bank; Apr 28, 1977. Getting Stronger: Women Workers Organize the Abortion Clinics, Red Sun Press; 1978. Populi, Journal of the UN Fund for Population Activities; Winter 1976. For Ourselves, Our Families, and Our Future: The Struggle for Childbearing Rights, Red Sun Press; 1979. Freeing Ourselves, Women Mobilized for Change; Mar 1973. Health/PAC Bulletin; Jul-Aug 1974. CCR Docket Reports; 1978-1979, 1979-1980, 1981-1982. Peace Action newsletter, War Resisters International. Women & the Law Report newsletter, Goldfarb, Singer and Austern; Mar 1983. Network News newsletters, NWHN; Jul 1982-Jul 1983. Reproductive Rights newsletters, R2N2; Summer 1980-Winter 1980. Family Planning Perspectives; Jul/Aug 1979. Local Monitoring Project Report, CESA; May 1978-Apr 1979. Health Right: A Women’s Health Newsletter; Summer 1978-1979. Knowledge and Control: The Issue of Abortion, Female Liberation; 1970. WIN: Peace & Freedom through Nonviolent Action; Mar 8, 1979. The New Leader biweekly; Nov 25, 1963. Report: Sterilization and Informed Consent Project; Jul 1976-Jun 1978

Pamphlets: Sterilization Abuse, Coalition for the Medical Rights of Women; undated Guidelines for the Management of DES-Exposed Daughters, State of CA Health and Welfare Agency; 1978. Women and the Cuban Revolution: Excepts from Two Speeches of Fidel Castro, Pathfinder Press; 1971. On Political Prisoners and Human Rights, Puerto Rico Solidarity Committee.

Newspapers: News & Letters “Human Power Is Its Own End”; Aug-Sep 1977. New York Workers’ News & Perspective: An Independent Newspaper of Labor and Community News; Jun 14, 1977. VOICE Literary Supplement #4; Feb 1980. Denuncia: Organo del Movimiento Anti-imperialista Por el Socialismo en Argentina; Aug 1977. Indochina Chronicle, Indochina Resource Center; Aug 1, 1972

Personal Letters to KS; Oct 1981; Letter to KS from Massachusetts General Hospital re: how use results of hospital sterilization surveys.

Materials sent to NWHN Executive Committee and Board: Contents include committee lists with chairs and job descriptions, organizational issues questionnaire responses, executive committee actions re: organizational issues questionnaire, financial policies, financial reports memos to executive committee re: legal guidelines for policy positions and legal actions taken on behalf of NWHN, board meeting attendance, and reports on committee activities.

Black Folder: undated. Contents include AVS info re: laws and legal status of sterilization for mentally disabled and handwritten notes

Light Blue Folder: NWHN Materials; Oct 1982-1983. Contents include NWHN work plan for Depo-Provera Project, draft of executive director work plan, report from the chair, and blank budget form for fiscal year 1983.

Light Blue Folder: CARASA Steering Committee Minutes Etc.; Jul 1981-Jun 1982 Contents include CARASA steering committee minutes with attached news clippings, letters to KS, and Reproductive Rights, newsletter of the Philadelphia Reproductive Rights Organization.

Envelope: P.R.; Dec 1974-Apr 1978. Contents include clippings re: Puerto Rico/Puerto Ricans

Green Folder: Abortion, Con-Con; Feb 1979. Contents include House Committee substitute for House Bills Nos. 523, 626, and 902.

Envelope: Coalition; Summer 1980. Contents include Coalitions News, newsletter of the Coalition for the Medical Rights of Women, and meeting notes of first fight-back against Supreme Court anti-abortion decision (McRae v. Harris).

Loose Papers: Pamphlet re: menstruation; National Center on Women & Family Law leaflets and publications list; Letter from Stanley Fink, Speaker of NY State Assembly; Sep 1982; Handwritten notes re: abortion; Map of nuclear reactors in US; Jun 1977; Correspondence, minutes, mission statements, and flyers from NWHN and CARASA; Law book clippings re: NYC and CA sterilization regulations; Buck v. Bell, Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals; Apr 1927

Yellow Folder: YMCA/NGO National Working Seminar on Development; Sep 26-28, 1978 Contents include seminar materials such as agendas, pamphlets re: including women in development efforts and population growth and land reform, 1978 world population data, working group report on population and development, testimony, and article clippings re: youth population and the Third World.

Light Blue Folder: KS; Dec 1981-Jan 1982. Contents include testimony on behalf of NWHN Subcommittee on the Constitution, Occupational Health Committee environmental / occupational history form, and Warning: Reaganomics is Harmful to Consumers, a consumer review by the National Consumer League.

Envelope: NWHN Materials re: Hospital Sterilization Surveys; 1981-1983. Contents include general letter re: hospital sterilization questionnaire and blank questionnaire, 1981-1982 registry of Ob-Gyn residency programs and their directors, several pages of doctor address labels, NWHN Reproductive Rights Committee membership lists, and internal correspondence.

Folder: Clippings. Contents include clippings re: medical info on breast and pelvic test methods, herpes, dioxin, estrogen, and other health subjects.

Poster: “People against Sterilization Abuse”, CESA (multiple copies)

Envelope: from ACLU; 1969-1977. Contents include handwritten notes re: Strunk v. Strunk, Holmes v. Powers, and Kentucky statutes re: non-therapeutic sterilization

Envelope: Sarah Wenick’s Draft of Article on Sterilization. Contents includes Wenick’s letter to KS with enclosed draft of article on contraceptive sterilization for Red Book.

 Papers, Records and Publications II 5 General note

Loose Papers: Legal divorce settlements and income tax regulations; 1983-1989; Clipping from law book on PL 37; 1977; CCR comments on renewal of federal sterilization regulations; Jun 1982; Planned Parenthood letter to Health Care Financing Administration; Jun 22, 1982; Bibliography; KS notes and papers; News Clipping re: sterilization as criminal punishment.

Folder: CARASA and CESA Materials; 1979. Contents relating to CESA include a meeting agenda and minutes, letter to CARASA steering committee, proposed procedure for educational, sample by-laws, and rules of internal procedure. CARASA materials include proposal for conference, conference agenda, CARASA News Special 1979 Conference Packet, and resumes.

White Folder: Keep it Fair. Keep it Safe. Keep it Funded. Contents relate to abortion campaign and include NY State Campaign for Abortion Rights pamphlet re: legislative process, CARASA resolution and lobbying techniques papers, an ABC News survey re: legalizing abortion, and “Keep it Safe…” button.

Folder: CARASA and Planned Parenthood Materials re: Trip to NY State Legislature Contents include a Planned Parenthood pamphlet re: NY state legislature, CARASA letter to NY State Legislature re: abortion, CARASA fact sheets, memos, and correspondence, names and addresses of healthcare, women’s labor, and other groups, and feedback reports from visit to legislators.

CARASA News, CARASA; Jan/Feb 1983

Green Folder: CESA. Contents relate to CESA and include press releases, meeting minutes, clippings re: sterilization abuse, a work plan for its outreach campaign, and handwritten notes.

Hanging Folder: NY Times Clippings; Nov 1990

Hanging Folder: NYC HHC Letters re: Annual Report and Sterilization Procedures; 1992

Hanging Folder: Charts showing percentage of US women using various contraceptive methods by age, race, marital status, etc.; 1982

Hanging Folder: CARASA Research Proposal to Study Voluntary Sterilization Counseling Programs at St. Luke’s-Roosevelt Hospital Centers; Apr 6, 1984

Hanging Folder: Chart comparing NYC Reg PL 37, Federal HEW Regs, and proposed state law (Nader’s Bill)

Folder: NYC HHC Materials; 1982-1988 Contents include correspondence, testimony and legal petitions, proposed resolution and news clipping re: testing for perinatal transmission of AIDs.

Folder: NYC HHC Sterilization Guidelines and Forms

Folder: NYC HHC Memos; May 1983-Apr 1985

Folder: CESA stats re: municipal hospital sterilizations; 1972-1978

Folder: NYC HHC Compliance with Sterilization Regs Annual Reports; 1986-1990

NYC HHC Annual Sterilization Stats; 1978-1982, 1985, 1986, 1988

KS student papers for Psychiatry and law seminar; Sep 1984

Student paper for sex roles and the law seminar; Dec 1976

Folder: Modern Eugenic Laws and Court Cases; 1978-1989

 Papers, Records and Publications III (1977-1984) 6 General note

Box is particularly disorganized. Materials seemed randomly filed together and I felt that I was doing an item by item inventory going through each folder so opted for a general narrative description rather than folder inventory.

This box contains materials from CARASA, Planned Parenthood, AVS, NWHN, NYC HHC, ACLU, CCR, JSAC, and others relating to sterilization abuse and rights. Materials include correspondence, minutes, newsletters, pamphlets and brochures, fact sheets, drafts of legislative bills, and drafts of chapters.

Correspondence re: CARASA sterilization monitoring project; Mar-Apr 1984

NYC HHC memos and brochures re: hysterectomy translated into Chinese, Spanish, French, and Russian; 1984

Envelope: CARASA Walk-a-Thon; 1984

Article clipping re: female sterilization; 1983

NYC HHC memo re: attached drafts of Nader Sterilization Bill

ACLU Reproductive Freedom Project Sterilization Subcommittee on the Mentally Retarded correspondence and minutes; 1983

CCR memo re: changes to Nader Bill

Planned Parenthood position paper re: sterilization in NYC

Pamphlet: In Support of Women: Why Safe and Free Abortion?, Indiana Feminist Alliance; 1982

Brochure on preterm vasectomy

Fact sheets re: sterilization abuse

News clippings re: sterilization abuse

JSAC Grapevine, Joint Strategy and Action Committee; Feb 1979

Planned Parenthood memo re: world population; May 1978

AVS News, AVS; Apr 1977

NWHN News, NWHN; Apr/May 1979

Letter to KS from Tom Shapiro with enclosed draft of chapter of book on sterilization abuse and population control in US; Oct 1983

Peace Action newsletter, War Resisters League; Aug/Sep 1983

 Papers, Records and Publications IV 7 General note

Loose Papers: Contains many unfoldered papers from organizations such as CESA, Coalition Against Sterilization Abuse (CASA), DHEW, CARASA, R2N2, and particularly NWHN. Materials include correspondence, memos, newsletters, position papers, statements of purpose, progress reports, program objectives, board minutes, petitions and testimonies, and flyers.

Folder: KS’s CESA Minutes and Notes; May-July 1977: 0.4 linear ft. of loose news clippings, mostly from the New York Times, re: hospital news; 1976-1978.

Folder: HHC. Contents include clippings and stats on sterilization abuse

Newspapers: Politics & Other Human Interests; Nov 22, 1977; Ob Gyn News; Aug 15-31, 1982; Indigena: News from Indian America; Summer 1977

Green Folder: CESA; 1976-1977. Contents include draft position paper, proposal for organization manual, proposed work plan, by-laws, CESA founding conference program, event flyers, pamphlets (in Spanish), press release, and education materials.

Folder: Public Attitude. Contents consist of tabulations from questionnaire Capitol Inquiry by Texan Senator Walter Mengden.

Folder: CESA Internal Documents; Oct 1976-May 1977. Contents consists of correspondence with members re: organizational restructuring.

Envelope: Betsy Hartman; May 1986. Letter from Betsy Hartman to KS with draft of chapter on sterilization for her Harper and Row book on population.

Folder: Mailing List of Organizations

Folder: Correspondence Referencing Literature Payments

Envelope: Clippings Misc.; 1972-1976. Clippings mostly relate to gender equity, particularly in the occupations.

Envelope: Bonnie Mass; Oct 1976. Contains handwritten notes re: sterilization

Envelope: Clippings re: status of women; 1977-1979

Folder: CESA materials relating to NYC HHC; 1975-1979. Contents include correspondence, fact sheets re: sterilization guidelines, and news clippings in Spanish.

Folder: Sterilization Regs; Jul 1975-Dec 1977. Some content in Spanish.

Journal: LAWG Letter, Latin American Working Group; Oct/Nov 1974

Newsletters: Network News, NWHN; Sep/Oct 1982-May/Jun 1983

Envelope: NWHN Manuscript Sterilization Abuse: What It Is and How It Can Be Controlled; 1981

 Papers, Records and Publications V 8 General note

Clippings Files. Clippings are filed in hanging folders with title labels. Original order kept. (Box handle broken; Title provided by archivist to better reflect folder content; Fragile. Handle with care.)

Abortion, 1979; Abortion, 1977; Abortion Court Cases; 1990; Senate Joint Resolution 19 re: Abortion Amendment; 1981; Abortion Counseling Press; Abortion Demographic Etc.; Abortion-Foreign Aid; Abortion Funding; Abortion Clinics Harassment; Human Life Act; Abortion Informed Consent; Abortion International; Abortion-Medical Abortion-Parental Notice, “Spousal Rights”; Pregnancy-Surveillance; Pre-Natal Testing; RU 486-Abortion Pill Testing, 1990; Viability; Access and Availability (MD Attitudes); AVS; Baby Doe Etc.; 1981; Bronx; 1981; California Regs; Church State, 1988; Contraception; Demographics; Depo-Provera; Squeal Rule Contraception, 1983; Fetal Experimentation and Use of Tissue; Infertility; Invasive Surgery on Pregnant Women; Joan Kelly; Mailing Lists; Marital Rape; NWHN; NWHN News 3/84-8/86; Pornography; AIDS; Compliance Studies-National Sterilization Regs; Sterilization Demographics; Sterilization, Medical; Monitoring and Reg of Health Care in NY; Monitoring HHS; Occupational and Environmental Health; Planned Parenthood; Population Control; Puerto Rico; Sterilization Regrets and Reverses; UK: Sterilization; Surrogate Motherhood; R2N2

 Papers, Records and Publications VI 9 General note

NOTE: Box not full.

Green Folder: Court Documents, 1977. Contents include petition of Richard Ruby v. Robert U. Massey re: guardianship of children, District of Connecticut.

Clippings: Eugenics Laws, 1975-1977; Clippings and Articles: Eugenics Misc., 1971-1977.

Envelope: Letters re: reporting hospital sterilizations. Contents include letters from several hospitals to Carter Burden, Council Member of 7th District, Manhattan re: fulfilling responsibility to report performed sterilizations.

Envelope: Packet #24, Part 1; Nov 1979-Feb 1980. Contents consists of clippings on various women’s issues put together by the Boston Women’s Health Book Collective

Envelope: Packet #24, Part 2. Contents consists of clippings on various women’s issues put together by the Boston Women’s Health Book Collective

Envelope: Packet #24, Part 3. Contents consists of clippings on various women’s issues put together by the Boston Women’s Health Book Collective

Envelope: Monitoring NY Hospital Sterilization Materials. Contents include letters to KS at CESA from various hospitals re: 1979 hospital questionnaires and compliance with PL 37, and charts and tables with info on how certain NY hospitals are funded and their payment policies

Envelope: Materials re: Abortion. Contents Include news clippings re: abortion, KS and Women’s National Abortion Action Coalition testimony for Albany hearings on alternatives to abortion, The Monthly Extract: An Irregular Periodical, and an info brochure on vacuum aspiration abortion.

Envelope: CARASA Materials. Contents include letters to NY state legislators, and info on lobbying techniques and legislative issues re: sterilization.

Hanging Folders containing Newspaper Clippings: Abortion, 1990; Abortion, 1989; Abortion, 1988; Abortion. 1981

 Papers, Records and Publications VII 10 General note

Folder: Bibliography. Contains recommended readings, annotated references, publications lists, and info about unpublished manuscripts re: population control, sterilization, abortion, pregnancy and birth, and women and the healthcare system

Publications: On the Liberation of Women in Albania, Gamma Publications undated; Sterilization Abuse: What It Is and How It Can Be Controlled, NWHN, 1981; JSAC Grapevine, Joint Strategy and Action Committee; Feb 1978; Sterilization: What You Need To Know Before Making a Decision, CESA (in Eng and Span), undated; WIN: Peace and Freedom Through Nonviolent Action, WIN Magazine and War Resisters League; Apr 1979; Notes from the Third Year: Women’s Liberation, Quadrangle Books, 1971; Twenty-Two Dimensions of the Population Problem, Worldwatch Institution; Mar 1976; Victims of Rape, National Institute of Mental Health, HEW 1977; Black Women’s Liberation, Pathfinder Press; 1971; 1962 Handbook on Women Workers, US Dept. of Labor, 1963; Health Right: A Women’s Health Newsletter (duplicates), 1977-1979; Local Monitoring Project Report, CESA, May 1978-Apr 1979; CARASA News, CARASA; Apr 6, 1978; How the Russian Revolution Failed Women, New England Free Press undated; Reproductive Rights Newsletter, New American Movement, undated; Body Politics, Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism 1980; Herbal Abortion: Using Plants to Induce Miscarriage, Alexandra Lett, 1977; Reproductive Rights Litigation Update, Planned Parenthood, Sept 1991, Mar 1994; Journal of the American Medical Association, Sept 4, 1981; Ill-Health, Poverty & the State, Freedom Press; 1946

Pamphlets: Chicanas Speak Out, Pathfinder Press, 1971; Public Affairs Pamphlet No. 65: Prostitution and the War, Public Affairs Committee, 1944; Hospitals in China, Insurgent Publications, 1971

Loose Paper: Norma Jean Serena v. Natalie J. Leezer

Folder: North Carolina Association for Retarded Children v. State of North Carolina

Envelope: Environmental Toxins-Birth Defects, 1980. Contains a Consumer Product Safety Network membership form, Carcinogen Information Program (CIP) Bulletin, and Friends of the Earth mailing re: birth defects caused by sperm exposed to toxins

Envelope: Contains 8x10 black and white photo of unidentified woman; undated

Envelope: ERA etc.; 1981-1982. Contains NOW Legal Defense and Education Fund mailing, info re: legislative status of 1982 bills affecting women, and news clippings re: the Family Protection Act and single parenthood

Envelope: Population Control, 1981. Contains memos, clippings, and concept paper re: AIDS

Envelope: To Be Ordered, Read, Joined, Etc., undated. Contains KS’s handwritten notes

Envelope: Ethics. Contains clipping re: doctor’s worst dilemmas

Clippings (0.25 linear ft); 1971-1981. Contains news clippings re: workers, ovulation, teenagers discussing sexuality in the mid-70s, abortion clinics, sterilization, and other subjects.

Loose Papers: Testimonies; May 1980-Aug 1982. Contains testimonies and commentary re: sterilization regulations made by Lois Salisbury, Public Advocates Inc, the Coalition for the Medical Rights of Women and others.

Envelope: Contains KS’s handwritten notes re: laws, morality, euthanasia, and abortion.

Folder: Hysterectomy; 1982-1983. Contains NYC HHC memos and pamphlets.

Envelope: Health Risks and Safety; 1980-1982. Contains student papers re: ethnographical factors in the delivery of health services, news clippings re: DES and children, non-smokers, and kidney-disease risk in surgery, and NWHN pamphlet re: how the FDA determines the safety of drugs.

CESA Monitoring of NYC Hospital Sterilization; Apr 1975-Mar 1979; CARASA Internal Rules of Procedure and Triannual Meeting Prep Materials, Oct 1981; R2N2 Population Control and Sterilization Abuse Slideshow Script, Oct 1982;
